entry.title: Proof-of-Stake Bitcoin Sidechains
entry.summary: ZmnSCPxj is intrigued by a mechanism using fixed R values to prevent multiple signatures. However, he wonders how to derive the R values uniquely for each blockheight to create signatures or verify them. One possibility is to use standard hierarchical derivation and require staking pubkey to be revealed as actually being `staking_pubkey = P + hash(P || parent_R) * G`. To sign for a blockheight `h`, one must use their public key `P` and the specific `R` derived from hierarchical derivation from `parent_R` and the blockheight as index.
